abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Technical Assistance
            Loan Project for El Salvador were as follows: Bank
            performance was satisfactory; and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: a clear and
            realistic definition of program objectives is essential to
            ensure a common vision of the long-term goals being sought
            and to measure ongoing progress. Objectives should be linked
            closely to a realistic impact assessment. A change in
            administrations during the life of a project may lead to
            delays in project implementation as well as the likelihood
            of redefinitions in reform priorities, which may affect
            long-term government commitment to certain reform components
            and thus future sustainability. Bridge projects are
            susceptible to changes in the leadership of key agencies
            involved in the reform process.
